conversation.message: School_D is my first-choice school. I’m applying because your program and community are the best fit for my goals, and if admitted I will gladly accept and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_D. Although School_D ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_E), applying immediately maximizes my chance if higher-priority students go elsewhere. Waiting risks losing the only seat. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for sharing why School_D is your first choice. After reviewing applications for this round and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_D and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority ranking is D > E > C > B > A. In this round I received applications from Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C on my list, and both indicate they would accept immediately. With quota 1, accepting Student_C now would block me from matching with the higher-priority Student_E. There is no indication that Student_E is unavailable; in fact, they proactively applied. Therefore I should reject Student_C to preserve capacity for Student_E, aiming for the highest possible match on my true priority list.

conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_D is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the possibility of joining your school community. I would like to formally apply and would be ready to accept an offer immediately if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_C, Student_B, Student_D). Those students also have strong incentives to apply there (Student_D has School_C as #1; Student_B and Student_C have it in their top 5). My best realistic shot at a high-ranked school is School_D, where I am ranked #2 in priority (only behind Student_D). Since Student_D’s top choice is School_C, there is a good chance Student_D applies to School_C first, leaving School_D attainable for me if I apply immediately. Therefore I will apply to School_D now to secure a strong match rather than likely being rejected at School_C and losing time.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your enthusiasm for School_D. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. Please confirm that you will enroll with us.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: School_D’s true priority is D > E > C > B > A. In this round, applicants are Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C, and we have quota 1. Student_D (our top choice) has not applied to us and ranks School_D last, so is unlikely to come later. Student_E ranks School_D 4th, but has explicitly stated they would accept immediately if admitted. Given limited capacity and to maximize our outcome within quota, accept Student_E now rather than risk ending unmatched or taking a lower-ranked student later.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_B and I’m formally applying to School_B as my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join and would gladly accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B’s priority list ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying in round 1 maximizes my chance if higher-priority students target other schools first. Even if rejected, I can pivot next round to my 2nd choice (School_D), where I’m ranked 4th but may still have a chance depending on others’ moves.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B.

Please confirm that you would like to finalize this match with School_B.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority order is D > A > B > C > E, and my quota is 1. Student_B is applying now and ranks 3rd on my list, so acceptable. However, Student_D and Student_A are higher priorities. Looking at students’ preferences: Student_D ranks School_B 3rd (after C, A) so may not apply to me early; Student_A ranks School_B 4th, also unlikely early. Student_C ranks School_B 3rd, Student_E ranks School_B 2nd. If I reject Student_B now, I risk ending unmatched if higher-priority students never apply. If I accept Student_B now, I fill quota but forego possibility of matching with D or A. Given the mechanism: once I accept, I’m removed and cannot upgrade later. Still, the chance that D or A applies to me in later rounds seems low because both have higher-ranked options and those schools may accept them. Student_B has me as first choice, so accepting secures a stable match with a reasonably high-ranked student (3rd). To maximize expected outcome under uncertainty, accept Student_B.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_A and School_A is my first-choice school. I’m formally applying because your academic environment and overall fit are exactly what I’m looking for, and I would be ready to commit immediately if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_A. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), it is still possible to win the seat if those higher-priority students apply elsewhere first. Since this is round 1 and there is no downside to trying immediately, I should formally apply to my first choice and clearly signal strong commitment to improve my chances in case of any discretion in tie-breaking or follow-up considerations.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for naming School_A as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_A, and we appreciate your readiness to commit. Welcome to School_A.
conversation.thought: Student_A is applying to us as first choice. On School_A’s true priority list, Student_A is 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D). Given the market, Student_B ranks School_A 3rd and likely applies first to School_B; Student_D ranks School_A 2nd but likely applies first to School_C. There is a meaningful chance neither B nor D applies to us this round, and even if they do later, we may already be matched and cannot switch. Since we must either accept or reject now, accepting Student_A secures a relatively high-priority match and avoids the risk of ending unmatched after rejecting. Therefore accept.

Given the quota is 1 and Student_D is still high priority and committed, accept now to lock in a good outcome.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

Sincerely,
Student_C
